? I am playing altogether too passively probably out of respect for my opponent. I should have been looking for more forcing moves. This is the third time I missed a better one because I was nervous of his plans. The obvious 25 e6! is much stronger here

25 e6! then if 25 .. Rxb2 26 e7 wins eg .. Re8 27 Rf8+ Kg7 28 R1f7+ 1-0

Passed pawns need to be pushed!

? A mistake by Black (first one!). This only draws, 33 .. h3 is winning

33 .. h3! 34 c7 Kd7 35 c8=Q Kxc8 36 Ke3 g3 0-1

So how did I miss the draw after 33 .. g3?

?? Losing

The correct move was 35 Kf3 with a draw

35 Kf3 g4+ 36 Kf2 a6 37 Kf1 Ke7 38 Kg1 Ke6 39 Kf1 etc

Its drawn because the Black King can't take either pawn. I should have seen this possibility - an important motif to remember.
